result.execSummary:
The defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).
  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$11,930.94 payable to Lorence S.  Any cash bail to be applied to Lorence S. before anything else.
$3,771.60 payable to Cities and Villages Mutual Insurance Company.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, AND restitution:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 7/31/2018.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts three and four; and consecutive to any other sentence including 15CF1749.

superMiscConds.notes:
Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed.
Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept. 
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No possession of a stolen vehicle, not to be in a vehicle that is stolen, and not to possess any keys of a stolen vehicle.
Comply with all child support court orders.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct  drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting. The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
__________
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may  be extended and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant wil be subject to certain conditions whiel on release to Extended Supervision and a violation of any of those conditions may rsult in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts  one and four; and consecutive to any other sentence including 15CF1749.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gequinn Gregory Harland

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: nm

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 (FOUR) YEARS, concurrent with count 3 and 4 and consecutive to any other sentence including 15CF1749, with credit for 0 (ZERO) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 (TWO) YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 (TWO) YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 (FIVE) YEARS, concurrent with count 1 and 4 and consecutive to any other sentence including 15CF1749, with credit for 0 (ZERO) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 (TWO) YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 (THREE) YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 (FIVE) YEARS, concurrent with count 1 and 3 and consecutive to any other sentence including 15CF1749, with credit for 0 (ZERO) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 (TWO) YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 (THREE) YEARS.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION AS TO ALL COUNTS:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed.
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- No possession of a stolen vehicle, not to be in a vehicle that is stolen, and not possess any keys of a stolen vehicle.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 07-31-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- Drivers license suspension NOT imposed.

RESTITUTION AS TO COUNT 3:
- Court imposes Restitution in the amount of $11,930.94, payable to Lorence S. to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 07-31-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. Any cash bail shall be applied to restitution paid to Lorence S. before anything else. Any payments made shall first be applied to restitution owed to Lorence S.
- Court imposes Restitution in the amount of $3,771.60, payable to Cities and Villages Mutual Insurance Company to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 07-31-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Documentation provided by the victim; received and filed.  nm

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court, defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland not in court, in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Held off the record. Case set for sentencing hearing.  Court in Jury Trial on another matter. No spins court available. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-02-2016 at 01:30 pm, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant wishes to plead NOT GUILTY. Defendant is charged as follows Count 1: Bail Jumping (Felony), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b), a Class H Felony. Count 2: Bail Jumping (Felony), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b), a Class H Felony. Count 3: Obstructing an Officer Causing a Soft Tissue Injury to Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(2r), a Class H Felony. Count 4: Escape from Custody (Custody for Crime), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.42(3)(a), a Class H Felony.

Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ LNR 
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1, 3 and 4: 

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 
Court VACATES Jury Trial date. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 07-18-2016 at 08:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Amended Information Received and Filed. LNR

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court, defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland not in court, in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing.   Defense counsel requests case be set for  Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Copies given to state and defense counsel. 

Parties to provide reports/summary of expert witness no later than 04-15-2016 by 5:00 pm. Any motions challenging the admissibility of proposed expert testimony due no later than 04-29-2016 by 5:00 pm. 

Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 05-26-2016 at 8:30, and Jury Trial scheduled on 06-06-2016 at 9:00 am, Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in custody. Peter Hahn on behalf of Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 03-31-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel contacted the court 02-24-2016 at 8:30 will not work with scheduled. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 02-25-2016 at 8:30 am., branch 17.

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court, defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland not in court, in custody.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for scheduling conference. Court in jury trial on another matter. Brief adjournment, case scheduled for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 02-24-2016 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM 
Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15CF1749 that are attached to the complaint. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Abby Bonville Officer for the City of Greenville Police Department.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Gequinn Gregory Harland in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
